p: Weighing the importance of these age-related risks and benefits is difficult because they occur in the context of a demographic network with age-dependent relationship durations and complex patterns of age-related homophily (i.e., the tendency of people to partner with people their own age) in which women also tend to partner with older men. Under these conditions, network models predict that the mean degree of the population will depend on the age distributionâ€“a distribution that can, in turn, be profoundly influenced by HIV-related mortality.
